sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Handwritten letter from Schenker to Busoni, dated August 30, 1903
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: In response to Busoni's expressed desire to include the Syrische Tänze, orchestrated, in a concert later in the year, Schenker admits that he would prefer, if possible, to orchestrate the work himself rather than using the orchestration on which Schoenberg was currently working.

tei:opener.tei:salute: Lieber u. sehr verehrter Freund!This letter is published in full in translation in Ian Bent, David Bretherton, and William Drabkin, eds., Heinrich Schenker: Selected Correspondence (Woodbridge: The Boydell Press, 2014), p. 36.

tei:div.tei:p: Ich habe mir die Sache doch anders überlegt. Am liebsten mache ich die Partitur selbst, ob nun Schönberg sie schon gemacht oder nicht (was ich erst in paar Tagen erfahren kann).Arnold Schoenberg had apparently, at the time of the first piano duet performance on January 26, 1900 (Sbb B II 3549), asked whether he might orchestrate Schenker’s Syrische Tänze, and the offer had been accepted. In response to a letter from Schenker (itself in reaction to the current letter), Schoenberg confirmed on September 12, 1903 (OJ 14/15, [1]) that he had made a start on the work. Ich bin dann in der Lage, sollte Erfolg nur beschieden sein, die Partitur zu verkaufen, u. einiges Geld, das ich so nötig brauche, damit zu verdienen.
Um baldige Antwort bittet Sie sehr

tei:postscript.tei:p: Die „N. freie Presse“ brachte neulich sehr Schönes über meine Ausgabe: ich hoffe, es freut auch Sie, das zu erfahren.

tei:div.tei:p: My thoughts on the matter are quite different. I should prefer to make the score myself, regardless of whether or not Schoenberg has already done it (which I may know in a few days' time). I shall then be in a position, if only success is granted me, to sell the score and with it to earn some money, which I need so badly.
Are you in agreement with this?
A speedy answer is requested by

tei:postscript.tei:p: The Neue freie Presse published something very nice about my edition. I hope you will be pleased, too, to hear this.
